title.value: Debiasing Counterfactuals In the Presence of Spurious Correlations
title.justification: The exact title as given in the user's submission
title.quote:
Debiasing Counterfactuals In the Presence of
Spurious Correlations

extractions.description: The paper introduces an end-to-end training framework that integrates debiasing classifiers and counterfactual image generation to expose and mitigate the effects of spurious correlations in medical imaging classification tasks. It also proposes a novel metric called Spurious Correlation Latching Score (SCLS) to quantify classifier reliance on spurious correlations.

type.justification: The paper primarily deals with experiments conducted on datasets to test the proposed framework and metric.
type.quote:
Through comprehensive experiments on
two public datasets (with the simulated and real visual artifacts), we
demonstrate that the debiasing method: (i) learns generalizable markers
across the population, and (ii) successfully ignores spurious correlations
and focuses on the underlying disease pathology.

name.quote:
